randgeo 0.3.0

Introduction to the randgeo package

Scott Chamberlain, Noam Ross, and Samuel Bosch

2018-05-18

Source: vignettes/randgeo_vignette.Rmd
randgeo_vignette.Rmd

randgeo is a no dependency R package for generating random lat/long positions, or random WKT or GeoJSON points or polygons.

The benefit of no dependencies is that it can easily be used in other packages without any pain. e.g., you may want to show examples in your package but you don’t want a heavy dependency just for examples.

This package is adapted from Javascript’s https://github.com/tmcw/geojson-random but with modifications.

Install

Stable randgeo version from CRAN

install.packages("randgeo")

Or, the development version from Github

devtools::install_github("ropensci/randgeo")
library("randgeo")

random position

rg_position()
#> [[1]]
#> [1] 47.57533 16.29058

Many positions

rg_position(10)
#> [[1]]
#> [1] 167.40900 -51.37691
#> 
#> [[2]]
#> [1] -39.749286   8.429805
#> 
#> [[3]]
#> [1] -66.41962  52.83255
#> 
#> [[4]]
#> [1] 120.208596   8.986696
#> 
#> [[5]]
#> [1] 120.10854 -45.42286
#> 
#> [[6]]
#> [1] -41.239265   1.438551
#> 
#> [[7]]
#> [1] -154.44149  -26.19894
#> 
#> [[8]]
#> [1] 84.24417 34.10322
#> 
#> [[9]]
#> [1] 42.14697 53.48165
#> 
#> [[10]]
#> [1] 84.155953 -9.300186

Random position within a bounding box

rg_position(bbox = c(50, 50, 60, 60))
#> [[1]]
#> [1] 54.59806 56.71724

Well-known text

random points

A single point

wkt_point()
#> [1] "POINT (111.3028606 41.9867394)"

Many points

wkt_point(count = 10)
#>  [1] "POINT (25.5379084 -58.9364771)"  "POINT (33.4263007 -34.2198043)" 
#>  [3] "POINT (-40.9187132 17.6596194)"  "POINT (-3.5987380 -53.7306518)" 
#>  [5] "POINT (-156.3750737 30.7534866)" "POINT (-8.0286977 -16.9043207)" 
#>  [7] "POINT (45.5985544 12.8425140)"   "POINT (175.3681776 -9.9522063)" 
#>  [9] "POINT (7.4677603 -50.8234570)"   "POINT (72.3440961 -70.5704145)"

Within a bounding box

wkt_point(bbox = c(50, 50, 60, 60))
#> [1] "POINT (53.0402147 53.9760614)"

The fmt parameter controls how many decimal points

wkt_point()
#> [1] "POINT (7.6176279 58.2471372)"
wkt_point(fmt = 10)
#> [1] "POINT (62.9177988600 -46.1598132324)"

random polygons

wkt_polygon()
#> [1] "POLYGON ((-143.7492596 -26.6878704, -139.8930205 -30.6083170, -135.5980114 -32.1146854, -136.8367651 -35.3415691, -143.3519580 -32.4742533, -145.2412750 -32.3092918, -144.4850292 -35.9795910, -145.0736082 -35.3224459, -146.2169373 -32.2807908, -149.4308010 -30.0095496, -143.7492596 -26.6878704))"

Adjust number of vertices (Default: 10)

wkt_polygon(num_vertices = 4)
#> [1] "POLYGON ((-90.5835377 42.9418435, -85.1567378 39.2424938, -99.1749720 37.5729547, -96.1274147 37.3313818, -90.5835377 42.9418435))"

Adjust maximum number of decimal degrees latitude or longitude that a vertex can reach out of the center of the Polygon (Default: 10)

wkt_polygon(max_radial_length = 5)
#> [1] "POLYGON ((-110.5550037 -13.4149810, -109.5381530 -15.4830914, -109.9540629 -15.7162001, -109.8261801 -16.2331246, -108.2691096 -17.7250653, -110.7057346 -17.1271081, -114.6150923 -13.3466285, -112.5862220 -12.0267752, -112.3284078 -11.7706581, -111.0223700 -14.5453673, -110.5550037 -13.4149810))"

Within a bounding box

wkt_polygon(bbox = c(-130, 50, -120, 60))
#> [1] "POLYGON ((-116.7019770 56.7704719, -105.9922575 55.4347045, -116.6835066 52.0947940, -110.8726728 48.3800343, -117.0318543 46.9520888, -116.9858889 45.1792681, -120.7369053 52.4003289, -120.9080289 52.0739934, -126.5314400 44.4535611, -126.3266472 50.4549311, -116.7019770 56.7704719))"

GeoJSON

random points

A single point

geo_point()
#> $type
#> [1] "FeatureCollection"
#> 
#> $features
#> $features[[1]]
#> $features[[1]]$type
#> [1] "Feature"
#> 
#> $features[[1]]$geometry
#> $features[[1]]$geometry$type
#> [1] "Point"
#> 
#> $features[[1]]$geometry$coordinates
#> [1] -56.097873   5.539252
#> 
#> 
#> $features[[1]]$properties
#> NULL
#> 
#> 
#> 
#> attr(,"class")
#> [1] "geo_list"

Many points

geo_point(count = 10)
#> $type
#> [1] "FeatureCollection"
#> 
#> $features
#> $features[[1]]
#> $features[[1]]$type
#> [1] "Feature"
#> 
#> $features[[1]]$geometry
#> $features[[1]]$geometry$type
...

Within a bounding box

geo_point(bbox = c(50, 50, 60, 60))
#> $type
#> [1] "FeatureCollection"
#> 
#> $features
#> $features[[1]]
#> $features[[1]]$type
#> [1] "Feature"
#> 
#> $features[[1]]$geometry
#> $features[[1]]$geometry$type
#> [1] "Point"
#> 
#> $features[[1]]$geometry$coordinates
#> [1] 50.75511 51.67953
#> 
#> 
#> $features[[1]]$properties
#> NULL
#> 
#> 
#> 
#> attr(,"class")
#> [1] "geo_list"

random polygons

geo_polygon()
#> $type
#> [1] "FeatureCollection"
#> 
#> $features
#> $features[[1]]
#> $features[[1]]$type
#> [1] "Feature"
#> 
#> $features[[1]]$geometry
#> $features[[1]]$geometry$type
#> [1] "Polygon"
#> 
#> $features[[1]]$geometry$coordinates
#> $features[[1]]$geometry$coordinates[[1]]
#> $features[[1]]$geometry$coordinates[[1]][[1]]
#> [1] -56.63661 -36.16272
#> 
#> $features[[1]]$geometry$coordinates[[1]][[2]]
#> [1] -55.79942 -29.25081
#> 
#> $features[[1]]$geometry$coordinates[[1]][[3]]
#> [1] -51.13069 -35.19335
#> 
#> $features[[1]]$geometry$coordinates[[1]][[4]]
#> [1] -54.29739 -38.58098
#> 
#> $features[[1]]$geometry$coordinates[[1]][[5]]
#> [1] -62.69334 -39.57013
#> 
#> $features[[1]]$geometry$coordinates[[1]][[6]]
#> [1] -59.61009 -37.34100
#> 
#> $features[[1]]$geometry$coordinates[[1]][[7]]
#> [1] -62.65346 -36.39837
#> 
#> $features[[1]]$geometry$coordinates[[1]][[8]]
#> [1] -61.24153 -29.79203
#> 
#> $features[[1]]$geometry$coordinates[[1]][[9]]

#> [1] -57.95069 -30.47318

Adjust number of vertices (Default: 10)

geo_polygon(num_vertices = 4)
#> $type
#> [1] "FeatureCollection"
#> 
#> $features
#> $features[[1]]

#> [1] "Feature"

#> $features[[1]]$geometry$type

#> 
#> $features[[1]]$geometry$coordinates[[1]][[2]]
#> [1] -36.15602 -25.55949
#> 
#> $features[[1]]$geometry$coordinates[[1]][[3]]
#> [1] -37.71734 -26.51488
#> 
#> $features[[1]]$geometry$coordinates[[1]][[4]]
#> [1] -35.62084 -21.36472

#> $features[[1]]$geometry$coordinates[[1]][[5]]

Adjust maximum number of decimal degrees latitude or longitude that a vertex can reach out of the center of the Polygon (Default: 10)
